title: Start
message: To begin the annotation process - press the "START" button.

title: Highlighting
message: Choosing aligning spans is done by highlighting them (see example of highlighted spans). To do that, left click the first word and don't let go until all the span is covered (the covered span will be colored orange to guide you). Give it a go, and then proceed.

title: Un-Highlighting
message: If you need to undo a highlighting, you can do so by pressing the ctrl button and highlighting the relevant span (see previous section).

title: Work Sentence-by-Sentence
message: You will work one summary sentence at a time, where you won't be able to proceed to the next sentence without highlighting all the current sentence. To help you focus, the current sentence will be in a red box.

title: Confirm Alignments
message:
When you are satisfied with an alignment, press the "CONFIRM" button. When you do this, the alignment is saved (its color is changed to a faded yellow).
Give it a go, and then proceed.

title: Bold - Full Sentence
message: To help you find the alignments, document words related to the words in the currently viewed summary sentence are in bold.

title: Bold - Span
message:
When a summary span is chosen (highlighted), the bolding narrows down to words related to the highlighted summary span, to help you better focus.
For example, the bolding helps us see that the currently highlighted span is aligned to part of the first sentence, and to another span further along.

title: Bolding Control
message:
In addition to the default bolding behavior, you can also control the level of bolding you want to see.
To do that, use the red slider at the top-right corner of the screen.
you can alter between:
  • No bolding (leftmost)
  • Current higlighted span bolding (middle)
  • Current sentence bolding (rightmost)
Play with it a little, and then proceed.

title: Single Word Hint
message:
If you want to find all the document words related to a specific summary word, without turning off the bolding option, you can simply hover with your mouse over the summary word, and it will "activate" the relevant document words (they will turn red).
For example, if you are overwhelmed by all the crash-related bolding, try to see where a "1:30" mention is found in the document by hovering over the "1:30" in the summary.

title: Old Alignments
message:
Every alignment that is approved, is saved and can be seen with a faded-yellow background.
You can control how many of the old alignment to see, by toggling the blue slider adjacent to the bolding-control slider.
You can alter between:
  • No previous alignments (leftmost)
  • Only Current sentence's previous alignments (middle)
  • All previous alignments (rightmost)
Play with it a little, and then proceed.

title: Revise
message: If at any given point you regret one of your old alignments, you have the option to Revise them. To do that - you need to click the "REVISE" button. (proceed for further explanation).

title: Revise - Choose Old Alignment and Fix it
message:
After clicking the "REVISE" button, you will enter the REVISE mode. Here, you first need to choose the alignment to revise.
If you hover over the old alignments, the document-summary pairs over which you hover would become "unfaded" to help you find the correct alignment. Once you found the alignment you want to revise, click it. This will leave only this alignment, and make it reviseable. Now you can highlight and un-highlight parts of the summary and document to fix the alignment.
Once you are satisfied, press "CONFIRM".
If you regret your changes, dicard them by pressing the "BACK" button.
Now, Try it out and make yourself comfortable with the "REVISE" option.
When you are finished, proceed to the next step.

title: Revise - Finish
message:
You can fix as many old alignments as you wish.
Once you are satisfied, click the "FINISH" button to save your changes and go back to the main annotation session.

title: End of Sentence
message:
Once you highlighted a full sentence, you will automatically be prompted to proceed to the next sentence.
Clicking the "NEXT SENTENCE" button will save the currently chosen alignment and will proceed to the next sentence.
Try it out, and when you are done, proceed to the next step.

title: Submit
message:
Once you are finished highlighting the summary, you will be prompted to submit your work.
Clicking the "SUBMIT" button will save your last alignment and submit your whole work.
